ioformat

Class IOCSV

  • java.lang.Object
    • ioformat.IOCSV

  • public class IOCSV
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles loading and persisting data in CSV format.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Initialization.

      Initialization.

      Initialization.
      IOCSV(boolean withCategory, java.lang.String separator, int type)
      Initialization.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void headerMode()
      This method configures the IO object to expect headers in the first line of the files to load.
      void noHeaderMode()
      This method sets up the IO object to read CSV data as if having no header line.
      DataSet readData(java.io.File inFile)
      Reads CSV data into a DataSet object.
      void writeData(DataSet dset, java.io.File outFile)
      Write the data to an output csv file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IOCSV

        public IOCSV(boolean withCategory,
     java.lang.String separator,
     int type)
        Initialization.
        Parameters:
        withCategory - Boolean flag indicating whether to operate in a supervised or unsupervised mode. If set to true, the labels will be read from or appended to the end of the line.
        separator - String that is the separator to use (can be a regex).
        type - Integer that is the feature type to load, as per DataMineConstants.

      • IOCSV

        public IOCSV(boolean withCategory,
     java.lang.String separator)
        Initialization. Sets the default data type to float.
        Parameters:
        withCategory - Boolean flag indicating whether to operate in a supervised or unsupervised mode. If set to true, the labels will be read from or appended to the end of the line.
        separator - String that is the separator to use (can be a regex).

      • IOCSV

        public IOCSV(boolean withCategory,
     boolean withHeader,
     java.lang.String separator,
     int type)
        Initialization.
        Parameters:
        withCategory - Boolean flag indicating whether to operate in a supervised or unsupervised mode. If set to true, the labels will be read from or appended to the end of the line.
        withHeader - Boolean flag indicating whether the file to be loaded has a header line or not. The same goes for saving data with or without headers.
        separator - String that is the separator to use (can be a regex).
        type - Integer that is the feature type to load, as per DataMineConstants.

      • IOCSV

        public IOCSV(boolean withCategory,
     boolean withHeader,
     java.lang.String separator)
        Initialization. Sets the default data type to float.
        Parameters:
        withCategory - Boolean flag indicating whether to operate in a supervised or unsupervised mode. If set to true, the labels will be read from or appended to the end of the line.
        withHeader - Boolean flag indicating whether the file to be loaded has a header line or not. The same goes for saving data with or without headers.
        separator - String that is the separator to use (can be a regex).

    • Method Detail

      • noHeaderMode

        public void noHeaderMode()
        This method sets up the IO object to read CSV data as if having no header line. It will not persist feature names if saving the data later. This is currently set as default.

      • headerMode

        public void headerMode()
        This method configures the IO object to expect headers in the first line of the files to load. Also, it will write a header line if persisting the data.

      • writeData

        public void writeData(DataSet dset,
             java.io.File outFile)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Write the data to an output csv file.
        Parameters:
        dset - DataSet object to persist.
        outFile - File that is the target output.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • readData

        public DataSet readData(java.io.File inFile)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads CSV data into a DataSet object.
        Parameters:
        inFile - File to load the data from.
        Returns:
        DataSet object that is loaded from the target input file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
